conversation.message: [APPLY] Hello School_D admissions team—I'm Student_C. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I’m strongly committed to enrolling if accepted. I’m looking for a rigorous environment and would be excited to contribute academically and to school life. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_D. Given School_D’s priority list ranks me (Student_C) 2nd, I have a strong chance if I apply immediately. However, Student_A ranks School_D 3rd and could apply here if rejected from School_E/School_B; Student_D ranks School_D 4th; Student_E ranks it 3rd; Student_B ranks it 3rd. To secure my best outcome, I should apply to School_D right away and emphasize fit and commitment.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_D is your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_D. We’re excited about the academic commitment you described and would be glad to have you join our community. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_C is applying in round 1 and ranks School_D as their #1, so acceptance would lock in a highly likely enrollment. On School_D’s true priority list, Student_C is ranked 2nd (behind Student_A). However, Student_A does not rank School_D highly (3rd) and is likely to apply first to School_E or School_B, where those schools may accept them, so waiting risks ending unmatched or settling for lower-ranked options later. Given quota=1 and no other applicants in the inbox this round, accepting Student_C secures a strong, high-priority match immediately.

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Committee—I'm Student_A. School_E is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I would enthusiastically accept and commit if offered admission. I’m ready to contribute strongly to the academic community and school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E. Although School_E ranks me behind Student_E and Student_B, applying immediately gives me the best chance before seats fill. I will clearly express that School_E is my first choice and that I will commit if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for ranking School_E as your first choice. After reviewing this round’s applicants, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLY from A, B, D, and E. School_E true priority is E > B > A > D > C. Since Student_E (our top choice) has applied this round and would fill our only seat, accepting Student_A now would block matching with Student_E and reduce our outcome. Therefore we should reject Student_A to preserve the seat for a higher-priority applicant (Student_E).

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining your school community and believe I would be a strong, committed member of the incoming class. I would like to formally apply for your open seat this round. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. However, School_C’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_A, Student_D), and those students have strong incentives to apply there early (especially Student_B who ranks School_C 2nd). If I apply to School_C now, I’m likely to be rejected and lose a round. By contrast, School_E ranks me 1st, so applying there now almost surely secures an immediate match. Even though School_E is my last choice, locking in a guaranteed match prevents ending up unmatched if other schools fill. Given the one-shot-per-round constraint and tight capacities, I should secure the safe acceptance first rather than gamble and get shut out.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and your interest in School_E. After reviewing this round’s applicants, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. We would be excited to welcome you to our incoming class.

Sincerely,

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_E’s true priority list. In this round, we also received applications from Student_B (#2), Student_A (#3), and Student_D (#4). With quota 1, the optimal outcome is to accept the highest-priority applicant available now. Student_E also applied directly to us (even though we are their 5th choice), and an [ACCEPT] immediately secures our top-ranked match and ends our search risk-free. Therefore, accept Student_E and fill the seat.

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_B. School_E is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join your community. If admitted, I will accept and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E. I also have strong priority there (ranked 2nd), which gives me a good chance if I apply immediately before seats fill. Since capacities are 1, I should apply to my best attainable option right away rather than risk losing it to other applicants.

conversation.message: School_E is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to enroll if admitted, and I would commit to School_E as my top preference. Thank you for considering my application.
